positive.review:
Great game, very original and fun to play. It has a lot of progress and never gets boring.
With NG+ progression mechanic, even replay is possible.
I call this my magic sleep game.  Don't get me wrong, it's been fun, but I also fall asleep playing it.
Second time finishing this, great game.

Great game to have in the background while reading. Also since it plays all the auto jobs while closed, its easy to just load up and finish a run quickly if you dont have much time. Mainly its rather addicting to watch the numbers go up *shrugs*

There's some seriously innovative stuff here.  Other incremental games don't have the sense of story that Increlution has, and the user interface is extremely clean and surprisingly powerful.  I have 15 hours logged, and maybe 10 hours of genuine activity.  With the status screen telling me that I've seen 5.9% of the content, this has been one of the most cost-effective games I've bought.  And let's face it, I play incremental games: that means I'm obsessed with resource efficiency.

Awesome game, even tho abandoned - you easily get your money´s worth x10 if you enjoy Idle/aka numbers go up and do things faster and more efficient each new Loop.

Hope the dev comes back one day and adds dlc or Incr. 2.0
Nice incremental game, that actually forces you to use your brain.
Pretty fun incremental, quite slow progress but very idle/background game.

Great game, very original and fun to play. It has a lot of progress and never gets boring.
With NG+ progression mechanic, even replay is possible.
I call this my magic sleep game.  Don't get me wrong, it's been fun, but I also fall asleep playing it.

Rougelite distilled to it's most fundamental parts.

Still needs some improvement, but I already saw two inspired games.
is a good game in general but dosent feel very fun to optimise your lifes after a little bit. thats my only gripe and thats probably more of a me issue.

This is like a Bitcoin Miner, but u don't have an annoying virus and uses less ram!
Nice side game 2 watch anime to!
10/10
If you like idle games and roguelikes, this distills them both into crack cocaine
With a little patience it will grow on you. Perfect for a second screen.
its a really good idle game to have on a 2nd screen when you are working or similar
Second time finishing this, great game.
I like the game
very cool.

negative.review: This really isn't much of a game - more of a tech demo.  There are few, if any, real decisions to make.  Beyond the first chapter, the game is pure repetition with increasingly longer time increments before anything resembling a decision arises.

Game is very, very repetitive, with very few decisions to make (none of them seem really impactful, or seem to be a lot more optimized)
- Start a run, wait a bit (15m+)
- Click a button or two, wait a minute
- Click another button or two, wait a few minutes
- reset
abandoned :/ like my love for it.

Okay-ish idler, but there was always something missing, and it seems to have been abandoned. So I can't recommend it, even if you can get quite some play time out of it.

[b]5/10

This really isn't much of a game - more of a tech demo.  There are few, if any, real decisions to make.  Beyond the first chapter, the game is pure repetition with increasingly longer time increments before anything resembling a decision arises.

Game is very, very repetitive, with very few decisions to make (none of them seem really impactful, or seem to be a lot more optimized)
- Start a run, wait a bit (15m+)
- Click a button or two, wait a minute
- Click another button or two, wait a few minutes
- reset

the developer may have put it on hold due to health issues, but as for now....

It's utterly boring, and just generally not worth the money yet. If i could i would refund it, but its way past it's time for me to do this, so...

Not for me.
I don't usually review games, but this game sucks, its terrible game mechanism.
abandoned :/ like my love for it.
dead and abandoned

Okay-ish idler, but there was always something missing, and it seems to have been abandoned. So I can't recommend it, even if you can get quite some play time out of it.
